AIRLINES
CANADA
U.S.A
BERMUDA
BILLFOLD EDITION

COLONIAL
The Stewardess on every Colonial airliner
is in attendance with only one oblective
In mind: To make your trip as comfortable
and as pleasant as possible.
Tust press
the button above your window, and
she
will be instantly at your service.
I she can help you with any of the fol.
lowing facilities, please don't hesltate to
call her.
* ADJUSTING YOUR CHAIR
At the touch of a lever your lounge chair
can be adjusted to any one of three posi-
tions. If you feel like a nap, perhaps you
will prefer to have it reclining,
and to
make use of a pillow or a lap robe.
* SEAT BELT
In accordance with Government require
ments, your seat belt must be
fostened
during take-off and landing.
The lighted
sign above the pilot's compartment will
remind you.
* MAGAZINES AND STATIONERY
The stewardess will be glad to supply you
with stationery,
or any of the following
magazines: Life,
Esquire, Reader's Digest,
Time, Colliers,
Motion Picture,
Saturday
Evening Post, New Yorker, American Trav-
eler and Official Aviation Guide.
There
is a reading light above your window.
Printod in U. 8. A.
* LAVATORY
The lavatory in the rear of the cabin is
equipped with soap, towels, Kleenex, etc.
It also contains a sterilized Schick Dual
electric razor, or if you prefer, a compli-
mentary Enders Razor and blade.
* COAT HANGERS
plane. Just call the stewardess and she
will take care of it.
We are permitted to
carry hats only in the rack
above your
seat.
* CIGARETTE SMOKING
PERMITTED
Except during landing and take off. Pipes
will be allowed provided they are not
objectionable to other passengers.
* HEATING AND VENTILATING
THE CABIN
Passenger cabins are heated to comfort-
able temperatures in winter, and air-cool.
ed in summer.
The entire air content is
changed once every minute, but if you
desire more fresh air, you need only adjust
the ventilator over your window.
* MISCELLANEOUS SUPPLIES
Chewing gum, aspirin, Alka-Seltzer, diges-
tive tablets and other supplies are obtain-
able from the stewardess.
In case of head cold or sinus trouble, ask
your
Stewardess for
a complimentary
Benzedrine Inhaler.
Complimentary cig-
arettes are available.

"SAFETY IS NO ACCIDENT"
A Statement by SIGMUND JANAS,
President, COLONIAL AIRLINES
Colonial Airlines is now in its 20th consecutive year of
scheduled airline service, having flown over 250,000,000
passenger miles without a single passenger or crew
or serious injury! This is a safety
record un-
equalled in the annals of commercial aviation! Safety
First shall always remain the watchwords of Colonial
operations as we link the peoples of Canada and the
United States ... span the Atlantic to the magic isles
of Bermuda ... and carry mail, freight and express.
. A. — BERMUDA
WESTBOUND
